Key activist against the oppression of Britain in support of the rights and privileges of the Colonies.
Calm judgment and prudence, Signer of the Non-Importation Agreement, Sixteen children
Last Signer of the Declaration to Die, Entered college at age 10, Also known as "Charles Carroll III"

Lawyer, Sons made POWs, Held grudge against Great Britain

Killed dueling

Immigrant merchant, Planner for Non-importation Agreements, Secret Committee member

Sided against the Regulators, Studied under James Otis, Federal Judge
Introduce Rhode Island bill in 1774 to prevent the importation of slaves, Manumitted all slaves in his possession.
Humorous, District Judge of Pennsylvania
Devoted Christian, Decisively minded, President of Congress-1779, Governor of Connecticut
Author of the Declaration, Vice-President, President

Declaration Committee, Chancellor of New York, Louisiana Purchase, Steam Power Engineer
Lawyer, Officer, Lost at Sea
records.placeOfDeath: Lost at sea (Atlantic), exact date unknown.
